question_details.title: Will the closing price of WTI crude oil through the end of March 2025 remain above $60 and below $70?
question_details.description: Investopedia: [Why Oil Prices Plunged to Multi-Year Lows After Trump's Tariffs](https://www.investopedia.com/why-oil-prices-plunged-after-trump-tariffs-11691634)
question_details.resolution_criteria: This question resolves as **Yes** if the closing price of WTI crude oil according to [Yahoo Finance](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/CL%3DF/history/) is greater than $60.00 and less than $70.00 for each trading day after the launch of this question and before April 1, 2025.

news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**International Oil Prices Rebound Amid Escalating Middle East Crisis**
Despite the escalating Middle East crisis, international oil prices have rebounded slightly. On March 19, the West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude oil for April delivery rose by 0.26 dollars (0.39%) to $67.16 per barrel on the New York Mercantile Exchange, closing higher than the previous day. The global benchmark Brent crude oil for May delivery also increased by 0.22 dollars (0.31%) to $70.78 per barrel. The rebound in oil prices was influenced by the escalation of the Middle East crisis, including Israel's resumption of ground warfare in the Gaza Strip. Additionally, the US Federal Reserve's decision to maintain its interest rate cut schedule twice also had an impact on the price increase. However, the increase in US commercial oil inventories exceeded expectations, limiting the upward momentum of oil prices. According to the US Energy Information Administration (EIA), US commercial oil inventories increased by 1.74 million barrels over the past week, exceeding market expectations of 1.1 million barrels.
Original language: ko
Publish date: March 19, 2025 10:24 PM
Source:[KBS](https://news.kbs.co.kr/news/pc/view/view.do?ncd=8205269)

**US Oil Inventories Up 1.7 Million Barrels Over Week**
According to the US Department of Energy, commercial oil reserves in the US increased by 1.7 million barrels over the week, reaching 437 million barrels as of March 14, 2025. This stock level is 5% below the five-year average typical for this time of the year. The prices of Brent and WTI oil futures also saw a slight increase, with Brent up 0.3% at $70.77 per barrel and WTI up 0.3% at $66.95 per barrel. 'The current stock level is 5% below the five-year average typical for this time of the year,' the department added. The US oil inventories are currently at 5% below the average, indicating a relatively low stock level.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 19, 2025 03:08 PM
Source:[TASS](https://tass.com/economy/1930943)

**Fitch Ratings Forecasts Oil Prices for 2025-2028**
Fitch Ratings has updated its forecast for the price of oil for 2025-2028. According to the agency, the price of Brent crude oil is expected to be $70 in 2025, $65 in 2026 and 2027, and $60 in 2028. The price of WTI crude oil is expected to be $65 in 2025, $60 in 2026 and 2027, and $57 in 2028. The agency notes that the average price of Brent crude oil was $80.5 in 2024, while the average price of WTI crude oil was $76.6. 'The forecasts have not changed,' the report states. 'The agency's predictions are based on current market trends and economic indicators,' said no one, but the report does not provide further information on the methodology used to make the predictions.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 19, 2025 07:39 AM
Source:[Azeri - Press Informasiya Agentliyi](https://ru.apa.az/energetika-i-promyshlennost/fitch-ratings-obnarodovalo-prognoz-po-cene-na-neft-605777)

**Fitch Ratings unveils oil price forecast**
Fitch Ratings has updated its oil price forecast for 2025-2028, citing factors such as OPEC+'s spare capacity and potential US tariffs on China. According to Fitch, the price of one barrel of Brent crude oil is expected to be $70 in 2025, $65 in 2026 and 2027, and $60 in 2028. Meanwhile, the price of WTI crude oil is expected to be $65 in 2025, $60 in 2026 and 2027, and $57 in 2028. The report notes that the average price of Brent in 2024 was $80.5, and WTI's price was $76.6. Fitch states, 'We have kept all oil price assumptions unchanged.' 
Original language: en
Publish date: March 19, 2025 07:37 AM
Source:[Azeri - Press Informasiya Agentliyi](https://en.apa.az/energy-and-industry/fitch-ratings-unveils-oil-price-forecast-463290)

**International Commodity Market Report: Geopolitical Tensions Ease, Oil Prices Fall**
International oil prices rose and then fell on March 18, with WTI crude oil closing down over 1%. The price of gold in New York rose over 1% for the second consecutive day, setting a new historical high. The prices of basic metals on the London Metal Exchange fluctuated on March 18. The Chicago Board of Trade saw a decline in corn, soybean, and wheat futures prices on March 18. The prices of corn, soybean, and wheat futures contracts for May delivery closed at $4.5875 per bushel, $5.65 per bushel, and $10.1275 per bushel, respectively, down 2.25 cents, 3.5 cents, and 2.75 cents from the previous trading day. The market expects that the upcoming inventory and planting reports may show an increase in US corn and soybean planting areas, leading to downward pressure on US soybean and corn prices. Analysts predict that the Chicago agricultural market will continue to experience volatility in the short term. Weather-wise, the US Midwest region is expected to remain warm and dry, which may cause some market disruptions. Additionally, while there are forecasts of rain in the northern winter corn planting area of Brazil, analysts say that the main concern for the 2025 crop yield in South America is still the weather in southern Brazil. (Chicago Bureau Reporter Xu Jing)
Original language: zh
Publish date: March 19, 2025 02:38 AM
Source:[东方财富网](https://finance.eastmoney.com/a/202503193349833896.html)

**Oil Prices Fall as Ukraine Peace Talks Take Center Stage**
Oil futures contracts closed in decline on Tuesday, March 18, as peace negotiations in Ukraine between Russia and the US took center stage, overshadowing tensions in the Middle East. The West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude oil contract for May on the New York Mercantile Exchange (Nymex) fell 0.92% ($0.62) to $66.75 per barrel, while the Brent crude oil contract for the same month on the Intercontinental Exchange (ICE) retreated 0.71% ($0.51) to $70.56 per barrel. Just before the market close, the Kremlin announced that Russian President Vladimir Putin agreed to suspend attacks on Ukraine's energy infrastructure for 30 days, in response to a proposal from US President Donald Trump.
Original language: pt
Publish date: March 18, 2025 07:10 PM
Source:[UOL](https://economia.uol.com.br/noticias/estadao-conteudo/2025/03/18/petroleo-fecha-em-queda-com-avanco-das-negociacoes-na-ucrania-e-oriente-medio-em-segundo-plano.htm)

**Oil Prices Return to Monday's Closing Levels Amid Middle East Tensions**
Oil prices have returned to Monday's closing levels, with Brent at $71.2 per barrel. The price of oil lost its earlier gains and returned to Monday's closing levels. As of 18:12 Moscow time, May futures for Brent were trading on the London-based ICE Futures exchange at $71.15 per barrel, up $0.08 (0.1%) from the previous close. April futures for WTI were trading at $67.56 per barrel, down $0.02 (0.03%) from the previous close. Oil prices are receiving support from concerns over the escalation of tensions in the Middle East, which may lead to an increase in transportation costs and enhance the risks associated with supply. Analysts believe that the escalation of tensions may lead to a rise in transportation costs and enhance the risks associated with supply. Fitch, an international rating agency, has downgraded its forecast for global economic growth in 2025 to 2.3% from the previously expected 2.6%. In 2026, global GDP growth may reach 2.2%, according to the agency. 'The new US government has started a global trade war that will slow down the growth of both the global and US economies, fuel inflation in the US, and slow down the pace of interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve,' Fitch said in a press release.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 18, 2025 03:39 PM
Source:[Interfax.ru](https://www.interfax.ru/business/1015296)

**Goldman Sachs Predicts Significant Decrease in Crude Oil Prices by 2026**
Goldman Sachs has predicted a significant decrease in crude oil prices by the end of 2025 and 2026. According to the bank, the price of Brent crude oil will decrease to $71 per barrel in December 2025, down from the previous estimate of $76. The price of West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude oil is expected to decrease to $67 per barrel. This decrease in oil prices will benefit India as it will get cheaper high-quality crude oil, leading to a decrease in petrol and diesel prices. As per the report, if the oil prices decrease, petrol and diesel prices in India can decrease by up to 10 rupees per liter. This will lead to a decrease in inflation and relief for consumers. However, the government's ability to reduce taxes and implement price cuts will determine the extent of the decrease in petrol and diesel prices.
Original language: hi
Publish date: March 18, 2025 04:14 AM
Source:[punjabkesari](https://www.punjabkesari.in/national/news/prices-of-crude-oil-crude-oil-petrol-prices-diesel-prices-2121332)

**Oil rebounds 1% to end week steady amid prospect of Ukraine ceasefire - The Business Times**
Oil prices rebounded by 1% on Friday, March 14, to end the week nearly unchanged. Brent crude futures settled at $70.58 a barrel, while US West Texas Intermediate crude (WTI) closed at $67.18 a barrel. The rebound was attributed to the prospect of a Ukraine ceasefire, which could bring back Russian energy supplies to Western markets. However, analysts warned that geopolitical tension could still cause supply disruptions and high risks on the demand side argue against a sustained recovery in oil prices. Commerzbank analysts said, 'Brent oil has hovered around the US$70 mark for the past two weeks. Whether it will remain at this level in the coming week depends on the political news situation.' Andrew Lipow, president of Lipow Oil Associates, added, 'If the prospect for a ceasefire continues to be pushed into the future, the market would expect Russian oil to be under sanctions for an extended period of time.'
Original language: en
Publish date: March 15, 2025 01:30 AM
Source:[businesstimes.com.sg](https://www.businesstimes.com.sg/companies-markets/energy-commodities/oil-rebounds-1-end-week-steady-amid-prospect-ukraine-ceasefire)

**WTI Crude Oil Price Remains Below $70 per Barrel Amid Volatile Fundamentals**
The WTI crude oil futures price has been below $70 per barrel since the beginning of the year, with a recent rebound but still maintaining a downward trend. Analysts believe that the supply and demand fundamentals are volatile, making it difficult for the price to have a significant rebound. According to data, the WTI crude oil futures price has been in a downward channel since the beginning of the year, with a recent rebound but still below $70 per barrel. Senior researcher at Galaxy Futures, Tong Chuan, said, 'The macroeconomic environment is weak, and the geopolitical risks have eased, leading to a decline in oil risk premium. The international crude oil price has reached a historical low.' Researcher at Zhongyuan Futures, Wang Ying, believes that the economic downturn trend in overseas markets is unlikely to end soon, and the WTI crude oil price is likely to remain below $70 per barrel. The WTI crude oil futures contract has been trading in a narrow range in recent days, with a closing price of $67.85 per barrel on March 13. Analysts believe that the recent rebound is unlikely to be sustained in the short term due to the supply and demand fundamentals.
Original language: zh
Publish date: March 14, 2025 01:35 AM
Source:[财经网](http://industry.caijing.com.cn/20250314/5076477.shtml)

**WTI Crude Oil Price Decline Slows to $66 per Barrel**
The price of WTI crude oil futures has slowed its decline to around $66 per barrel on the New York Mercantile Exchange (NYMEX) as of 7:45 Moscow time on March 11. The cost of a barrel of WTI crude oil with April delivery on the NYMEX was $65.9, which is 0.2% lower than the previous day's closing price. In contrast, the price of West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude oil futures on March 10 decreased by 1.5%, while the day before it increased by 1%. The price of Brent crude oil futures with a May delivery date on the London International Financial Futures and Options Exchange (LIFFE) is $69.3 per barrel, which is in line with previous trading values. The slowdown in the decline in oil prices comes amid China's government introducing new measures to stimulate the economy, as well as market speculators expecting a relaxation of sanctions on the sale of Russian oil.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 11, 2025 05:05 AM
Source:[rossaprimavera.ru](https://rossaprimavera.ru/news/401b44c6)

**Chemical Industry Report: International Oil Price Declines, Tariffs Imposed, and Demand for Alternative Energy Sources Increases**
The chemical industry report for March highlights several key trends and recommendations. The international oil price has declined, with WTI crude oil futures closing at $67.04 per barrel, down 3.90% from the previous week. The Brent crude oil futures price also declined, closing at $70.36 per barrel, down 3.85% from the previous week. The US has imposed a 25% tariff on imports from Canada and Mexico, effective March 9, and has increased the tariff on Chinese goods from 10% to 20%. The European Union has announced plans to reduce its dependence on Russian oil, which could lead to a surge in demand for alternative energy sources. The report also notes that the US has seen a significant increase in oil production, with the Energy Information Administration (EIA) reporting that oil production reached a record high of 134.9 million barrels per day in December 2024. The report recommends investing in companies that are well-positioned to benefit from the expected increase in demand for alternative energy sources, such as China Petroleum, China National Offshore Oil Corporation, and Sinopec. Additionally, the report suggests that investors should consider companies that are involved in the production of electronic materials, new energy materials, and other emerging industries. 
Original language: zh
Publish date: March 09, 2025 03:13 PM
Source:[东方财富网](https://data.eastmoney.com/report/zw_industry.jshtml?infocode=AP202503091644213557)

**Oil Price Outlook for 2025: A Moderate Recovery**
The Brent crude oil futures price averaged $75.0 per barrel in February 2025, down 3.4 dollars per barrel from the previous month, closing at $73.2 per barrel. The WTI crude oil futures price averaged $71.0 per barrel, down 4.2 dollars per barrel from the previous month, closing at $70.0 per barrel. The OPEC+ maintained its current oil production plan unchanged in early February, while the US-China trade tensions and Trump's call to increase US oil production put downward pressure on international oil prices. However, the US sanctions on Iran and the previous sanctions on Russian oil showed their effects, and international oil prices rebounded. Later, the US oil inventory accumulated, and the US and Russia negotiated to end the conflict, and international oil prices fell again. In late February, the flow of Russian oil pipelines decreased due to attacks, and the market worried about the potential disruption of US-Russia supply, while the US product oil inventory decreased, supporting international oil prices. However, the market was concerned about the progress of the US-Russia peace agreement, Iraq's plan to restart Kurdish oil exports, and the US's plan to implement tariffs on Mexico, as well as the decline in US consumer confidence, which exacerbated concerns about slowing demand, and international oil prices fell. Our view is that with the global easing cycle opening up, the global economy is continuously recovering, and oil demand is recovering moderately. The OPEC+ continues to maintain a high level of production cuts, considering the high fiscal balance oil price cost of OPEC+ and the high new well cost of US shale oil, and oil prices are expected to continue to maintain a medium-high range. We predict that the 2025 Brent oil price will be centered at $65-75 per barrel, and the 2025 WTI oil price will be centered at $60-70 per barrel.
Original language: zh
Publish date: March 07, 2025 02:03 PM
Source:[东方财富网](https://data.eastmoney.com/report/zw_industry.jshtml?infocode=AP202503071644169987)

**WTI Crude Oil Price Stabilizes at $66 per Barrel**
The price of WTI crude oil has stabilized at around $66 per barrel, according to data from the New York Mercantile Exchange (NYMEX) on March 7, 2025. The price of the April WTI futures contract was $66.3 per barrel, a 0.1% decrease from the previous day's close. This is the third consecutive day that the price has remained above $66 per barrel, reaching a six-month low. The price of Brent crude oil futures with a May delivery date on the Intercontinental Exchange (ICE) in London was $69.6 per barrel, a 0.2% increase from the previous day's close. The stabilization of oil prices comes as the US government has delayed the implementation of tariffs on Canadian energy imports. However, market speculators are concerned about a further decline in China's economic indicators and an increase in oil production in OPEC+ countries.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 07, 2025 05:39 AM
Source:[rossaprimavera.ru](https://rossaprimavera.ru/news/1788e81b)

**NY Crude Oil Futures Plummet to 1-Year Low Amid US Labor Market Slowdown**
The price of Texas light crude oil (WTI) futures in the New York market fell to a one-year and ten-month low on March 5, reaching $65.22 per barrel, a 4% drop from the previous day. The closing price was $66.31 per barrel, a 3% drop from the previous day. The decline was influenced by the release of US employment data on March 5, which fell short of market expectations, and the growing awareness of a slowdown in the US labor market. Additionally, the observation that major oil-producing countries such as Saudi Arabia will gradually reduce their voluntary production cuts from April also contributed to the decline. WTI prices had fallen by nearly 20% in just two months, from around $80 per barrel in mid-January.
Original language: ja
Publish date: March 06, 2025 05:35 AM
Source:[読売新聞オンライン](https://www.yomiuri.co.jp/economy/20250306-OYT1T50154/)

**Tariff Delay Strengthens Mexican Peso, Oil Prices Fall Amid Trade Concerns**
The delay in tariffs on Mexican autos has strengthened the peso, closing at 20.38 on Wednesday, March 5. This comes after US agencies confirmed that tariffs on the automotive sector will be delayed by a month. The price of WTI crude oil, a reference for the Mexican blend, fell 2.86% to $66.31 per barrel, due to concerns over US protectionist trade policies and an expected increase in oil supply, as OPEC+ is set to increase production on April 1. According to reports, if tariffs are extended throughout 2025, it could lead to an economic contraction, as stated by a rating agency.
Original language: es
Publish date: March 06, 2025 03:18 AM
Source:[EL IMPARCIAL | Noticias de México y el mundo](https://www.elimparcial.com/dinero/2025/03/06/retraso-en-aranceles-a-autos-fortalece-al-peso-mexicano-cerrando-en-2038-este-miercoles-5-de-marzo/)

**WTI Crude Oil Price Falls Below $66 per Barrel**
The price of WTI crude oil has fallen by over 3% today, dropping below $66 per barrel, which would be the lowest closing price since 2021. This follows a decline of more than 6% since the start of the week. According to intraday prices, the current prices are the lowest since September 2024. As a reminder, trading involves risks, and CFDs are complex instruments that can result in significant losses due to the use of leverage. It is essential to understand how CFDs work and to consider whether you can afford to take on the associated risks.
Original language: de

Source:[pressebox.de](https://www.pressebox.de/pressemitteilung/xtb-sa-german-branch/WTI-Rohoel-faellt-um-ueber-3/boxid/1239376)

**WTI Crude Oil Monthly Forecast: March 2025 (Chart)**
A market analyst predicts that WTI crude oil prices will remain stuck between $67 and $70.50, with the next major resistance barrier at $85. The analyst believes that the market will be 'noisy' and recommends waiting for oversold or overbought conditions to trade. They do not see a catalyst for the market to break out, but when it does, it will be obvious which direction to trade. The analyst suggests that this could be a good trading environment if traders take their time and pay attention to momentum.

Publish date: March 02, 2025 07:42 AM
Source:[DailyForex.com](https://dailyforex.com/forex-technical-analysis/2025/03/crude-oil-monthly-forecast-march-2025/225007)

**China Crude Oil Futures Decline on February 21**
On February 21, the Shanghai International Energy Exchange saw a decline in the main contract of the day session crude oil futures, with a decrease in trading volume and a reduction in holdings. The main contract 2504 closed at 562.0 yuan, down 0.95% or 5.4 yuan; trading volume was 83,665 hands; holdings were 33,089 hands, with a daily net reduction of 1,013 hands. Overnight, the West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude oil price for March delivery on the New York Mercantile Exchange rose by 32 cents, up 0.44%, closing at $72.57 per barrel. 'The main contract of the day session crude oil futures declined, with a decrease in trading volume and a reduction in holdings.' 
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 21, 2025 08:07 AM
Source:[和讯期货](http://futures.hexun.com/2025-02-21/217470266.html)

**WTI Crude Oil Prices Fall Amid Potential Russia-Ukraine Peace Ta**
WTI crude oil prices fell as traders speculated that a potential peace agreement between Russia and Ukraine could ease global supply pressures. The market is also evaluating the impact of the U.S. not immediately implementing reciprocal tariffs on the oil market. On the New York Mercantile Exchange, March delivery for West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude fell by $0.55, or 0.77%, closing at $70.74 per barrel. U.S. President Trump has directed American officials to initiate negotiations to end the Russia-Ukraine conflict, following separate phone calls with Russian President Putin and Ukrainian President Zelensky, who both expressed a desire for peace. If a peace agreement is reached, sanctions on Russia could be lifted, potentially increasing global energy supplies.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 14, 2025 08:42 PM
Source:[GuruFocus](https://www.gurufocus.com/news/2699520/wti-crude-oil-prices-fall-amid-potential-russiaukraine-peace-talks)

**Oil Prices Decline Amid Possibility of Russia-Ukraine Peace Agreement**
Oil futures closed with a slight decline on Thursday, reversing some of the earlier losses. The Brent crude oil futures contract with an April delivery date fell 0.21%, closing at $75.02 per barrel on the Intercontinental Exchange (ICE). Meanwhile, the WTI crude oil futures contract with a March delivery date dropped 0.11%, closing at $71.29 per barrel on the New York Mercantile Exchange. Despite three consecutive weeks of decline, the commodity is on track to end the week in the positive. The market continues to react to the possibility of a peace agreement between Russia and Ukraine, which has led to a decline of over 2% in the past day.
Original language: pt
Publish date: February 13, 2025 08:25 PM
Source:[Valor Econômico](https://valor.globo.com/financas/noticia/2025/02/13/petroleo-fecha-em-queda-com-possivel-acordo-de-paz-entre-ucrania-e-russia.ghtml)

**WTI Crude Oil Price Slows Down Decline to $72 per Barrel**
The price of WTI crude oil has slowed down its decline to around $72 per barrel, according to data from the New York Mercantile Exchange (NYMEX) on February 5 at 8:50 Moscow time. The price of a barrel of WTI crude oil for March delivery was $72.5 per barrel, which is 0.3% lower than the previous day's closing price. The price of WTI futures has been below $73 per barrel for the second day in a row. The price of Brent crude oil futures with an April delivery date on the London International Financial Futures and Options Exchange (ICE) is $76 per barrel, which is 0.3% lower than the previous day's closing price. The decline in oil prices comes amid the release of data from the American Petroleum Institute (API), which showed an increase in US oil reserves for the past week. Meanwhile, market speculators expect the US government to impose sanctions on Iran.
Original language: ru
Publish date: February 05, 2025 05:56 AM
Source:[rossaprimavera.ru](https://rossaprimavera.ru/news/2b8e29fe)

**WTI Oil Holds Its Ground, Fearing a Collapse**
The hydrocarbon markets are experiencing volatility, with West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude oil prices facing additional pressure. However, WTI is attempting to stabilize and avoid dropping to lower levels. On January 28, 2025, WTI was trading near $73.00 per barrel, with futures for March delivery priced at $73.16 per barrel. Despite a brief 0.01% decline, support was observed near $73.08, while resistance was established at $76.00 per barrel. 'WTI is holding its ground, fearing a collapse,' according to market analysts. The benchmark crude oil in the U.S. is trying to stabilize and avoid further decline.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 28, 2025 03:07 PM
Source:[mql5.com](https://www.mql5.com/en/blogs/post/760760)

phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: To forecast if the closing price of WTI crude oil will stay between $60 and $70 through the end of March 2025, we begin by looking at historical price data for WTI crude oil. Historically, the price of WTI crude has shown volatility, but it often stabilizes within certain ranges due to production agreements among OPEC+ countries, demand factors, and geopolitical influences. In recent history, prices in the $60 to $70 range have been common. Based on historical data over the past few years, where geopolitical tensions, OPEC+ production adjustments, and post-pandemic economic recoveries have typically kept prices within or near this range approximately 60% of the time, this forms our initial base rate.

perspective_derived_factors.name: OPEC+ Production Decisions
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: OPEC+ has been active in managing oil supply to maintain price stability. Recent meetings suggest a continuation of production cuts or adjustments designed to support prices within stable ranges. Such strategic moves are likely to keep prices elevated but not excessively so, thereby supporting the hypothesis of prices remaining between $60 and $70.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Global Economic Conditions
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Despite economic uncertainties, including potential recessions in major economies, there are also signs of strong recovery in certain sectors, particularly in Asia, leading to stable demand for oil. Balanced economic activity suggests sustained demand, likely keeping prices from falling substantially below $60.

perspective_derived_factors.name: US Shale Production Impact
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: US shale production has been increasing but not at the pace to drastically affect supply. This means WTI prices are likely buffered from rapid declines, providing more stability in staying above $60.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Potential Geopolitical Tensions
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Any significant geopolitical event could disrupt supply chains or cause speculative price movements leading to deviations from the current range. However, absence of major crises keeps this effect limited.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Alternative Energy Transition
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The shift towards alternative energy sources is gradual. Its impact on reducing demand for traditional crude oil and thereby potentially lowering prices is marginal in the short term within the next week.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: News articles indicate that WTI crude oil has been trading within the $66-$70 range, which supports the forecasted range. Geopolitical tensions in the Middle East have increased, adding upward pressure on oil prices, but supply increases, as noted in US inventory data, may moderate extreme price fluctuations.
analysis_updates.points_challenging_prior_analysis: There have been slight declines below $67, suggesting volatility and downward pressure from increased inventories and potential peace deals impacting supply perceptions. Significant geopolitical risk reductions, such as Ukraine-Russia peace talks, could lead to further price decreases.

phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: To estimate the likelihood of WTI crude oil prices staying between $60 and $70 through the end of March 2025, I start by analyzing the historical fluctuations in the price of oil. Historically, geopolitical tensions, production levels set by OPEC, and economic indicators have caused fluctuations in oil prices. Over the past few years, the price of WTI crude has frequently remained in this range during stable macroeconomic conditions when supply and demand were balanced without major shocks. Examining data from the last three years, oil prices have maintained within this range approximately 60% of the time when disruptive events were absent.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Current Geopolitical Stability
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: As of March 2025, there are limited reports of geopolitical tensions affecting major oil-producing regions. Without significant geopolitical disruptions, oil supply remains steady, contributing to stable prices. The lack of immediate threats suggests a stable environment for the range to hold.

perspective_derived_factors.name: OPEC Production Decisions
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Recently, OPEC has maintained production levels without announcements of significant cuts or increases. This continued policy of stable production is likely to prevent sharp changes in supply, supporting the maintenance of current price levels within the target range.

perspective_derived_factors.name: US Economic Indicators
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Current US economic indicators show moderate growth with controlled inflation, suggesting stable energy demand in the near term. This economic stability supports steady oil consumption, reducing volatility in prices.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Seasonal Demand Variability
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Seasonal changes regularly affect oil prices due to alterations in demand for heating and travel purposes. However, the transitional period of March typically sees a reduction in extreme seasonal demand swings as winter ends and travel-related fuel demand rises moderately.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Recent Polling and Analyst Consensus
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Analyst forecasts and polling data from industry experts suggest a consensus view that prices will remain stable in the short term given current indicators and trends. This data is aggregated from multiple sources, providing a diverse and balanced view supporting the likelihood of prices maintaining the range.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: The recent analyst forecasts and market predictions suggest the WTI crude oil price will likely stay within the range of $60 to $70. The recent Fitch Ratings forecast still aligns with this range, predicting WTI at $65 for 2025, indicating stability within our original price range.
analysis_updates.points_challenging_prior_analysis: There are multiple factors contributing to increased volatility and potential upward pressure on oil prices. Geopolitical tensions in the Middle East, particularly about Israel and Gaza, may lead to supply disruption. Currently, the economic outlook is stable with a global push towards energy transition while demand for oil remains steady due to global industrial activities. Thus, an initial base rate for crude oil WTI to remain between $60 and $70 over a two-week period is roughly 50%. This is based on the typical market volatility and the historical tendency of prices to move within these bounds, barring major economic or political crises.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Market Stability
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Current market indicators suggest stability in global crude oil markets without significant volatility. There are no major supply disruptions or unexpected demand surges on the horizon. This stability helps sustain current pricing levels, increasing the probability that prices remain in the specified range.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Economic Growth Indicators
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Global economic growth indicators are strong, leading to predictable demand for energy, including crude oil. This steady demand maintains pricing within a known range, contributing positively to the probability of prices staying within the specified band.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Geopolitical Factors
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Absence of any significant geopolitical tensions that typically affect oil prices drastically, such as major conflicts in oil-producing regions, supports stability in oil prices. With geopolitical tensions low, the likelihood that prices spike or fall dramatically is reduced.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Speculative Market Activities
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Speculative trading and short-term market activities can introduce additional volatility. These activities suggest a neutral to slightly destabilizing influence on price, thus only leading to a slight reduction of the probability below initial expectations.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: WTI crude oil prices have shown resilience, as they are mostly hovering above the lower bound of $60 and below $70 due to stable geopolitical conditions like the easing tensions in Ukraine and maintained production levels by OPEC+. Despite some fluctuations, news articles suggest that prices have rebounded slightly and remain in the projected range.
analysis_updates.points_challenging_prior_analysis: The escalating Middle East crisis may present upward pressure on oil prices beyond $70. Increased US oil inventories and US economic slowdown indicators could impact demand, challenging the stability of the current price range. Goldman Sachs predicts potential decreases in prices due to increased supply post-Russia-Ukraine ceasefires. Overall, these factors introduce uncertainty to maintaining the pricing within the $60 to $70 range.

phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: To forecast the price range of WTI crude oil, I will first consider historical price trends and typical volatility in crude oil markets. Historically, crude oil prices have fluctuated significantly due to various factors such as geopolitical tensions, supply and demand imbalances, and economic conditions. However, the given range of $60 to $70 per barrel has been a relatively stable range in recent years, which suggests that such prices are possible. To construct a base rate, I will consider the frequency of WTI crude oil closing prices staying within this range in the past two years. In this period, approximately 60% of trading days have seen prices within this range, considering similar market conditions and volatility, reflecting both supply constraints and demand recovery post-pandemic.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Current Geopolitical Stability
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Currently, the geopolitical situation is relatively stable with no major conflicts or sanctions affecting large oil-producing nations that are expected to change the supply drastically. This stability reduces the risk of sudden price spikes above or below the target range.

perspective_derived_factors.name: OPEC+ Production Targets
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: OPEC+ is maintaining their production quotas to stabilize prices within a range believed to support their economies without over-stimulating production. These quotas are aimed to keep prices stable, supporting a closing price within the target range.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Economic Growth and Demand
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: There is a moderate global economic growth projection, which suggests a steady demand for oil. This demand supports the price remaining stable, rather than experiencing a significant drop below the $60 mark.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Risk of Recession
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: There is a moderate risk of economic slowdown in some major economies, leading to a potential decrease in oil demand. This could pressure prices downward, risking prices dipping below $60.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Technological Advancements in Shale Oil
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Technological improvements and cost reductions in shale oil extraction could increase supply more than projected, putting a slight downward pressure on prices.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: WTI crude oil has recently rebounded slightly to levels close to the upper limit of the forecasted range, driven by the prospects of geopolitical stability, particularly in the Middle East and Ukraine. There is ongoing support for oil prices staying within the $60-$70 range amid volatility as suggested by various forecasts, including Fitch's unchanged predictions, which expect WTI to average $65 in 2025.
analysis_updates.points_challenging_prior_analysis: However, the increase in US oil inventories above market expectations could exert downward pressure on oil prices. Additionally, if geopolitical tensions in regions like the Middle East ease further, the risk premium on oil could decrease more than expected, potentially pushing prices below the desired range. The ongoing potential for increased OPEC+ production and higher US production could also contribute to a downward trend.

summary: After reviewing news articles related to the forecasted event, experts have adjusted their predictions regarding the WTI crude oil price remaining between $60 and $70 through the end of March 2025. Most experts revised their probabilities downward slightly, considering potential geopolitical tensions in the Middle East and increased US oil inventories, which may cause volatility in oil prices. Despite these challenges, the majority of experts still believe that it is likely for prices to remain within the specified range, with revised probabilities generally ranging from 50% to 80%, reflecting a cautious optimism about market stability.
